TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed XmlSeverityType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents the severity of the validation event.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Xml.Schema.XmlSeverityType Error = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates a validation error occurred when validating the instance document. This applies to document type definitions (DTDs) and XML Schema definition language (XSD) schemas. The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) validity constraints are considered errors. If no validation event handler has been created, errors throw an exception.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Xml.Schema.XmlSeverityType Warning = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that a validation event occurred that is not an error. A warning is typically issued when there is no DTD, or XML Schema to validate a particular element or attribute against. Unlike errors, warnings do not throw an exception if there is no validation event handler.
